did.abstract: Account books and receipts dated from 1790 to 1819 and pertaining to the affairs of Josiah Dikeman, a Brooklyn tailor.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The papers were formally accessioned in 1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into two folders by type: account books in one folder, receipts and documents in another.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Josiah Dikeman (circa 1759-1819) was a resident of Brooklyn. He is listed in an 1811 Brooklyn Directory as a tailor who lived on Liberty Street.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Josiah Dikeman papers, 1977.299, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Josiah Dikeman papers span the period 1790 to 1819 and measure 0.1 linear feet. The papers include an account book, dated 1780 to 1790; an account book for the sale of household goods, dated 1819; and forty-six receipts for tailor work, household goods, and medicine, dated 1785 to 1820. On many documents in the collection, Dikeman's last name is alternately spelled Dykeman and Diteman.
